text: Holy smokes, I'm 62 and I'm just really discovering the magic that is John Mayer!  Where have I been?  Stuck in legend land with James Taylor and CSNY.  I play acoustic guitar and sing but just had vocal tumors removed (benign - whew) but I just learned 'Why Georgia' and started learning 'No Such Thing' (that I think is targeted toward high school/early college kids, but I'm stuck!) I gotta learn more!  Neon will be a waaaayyy off in the future but this song is Beautiful!, Beautiful!  I wish I could see you live in Charlotte but my wife and I will be celebrating our 28th wedding anniversary and funds are tight due to the economy and work, so, I will learn this song and sing it with her...acoustically.  John, respectfully, I think you're an ancient alien, with your amazing talent gifted from God or the gods!  Late but grateful to have discovered John Mayer!!😁

text:
damn straight, i fell so hard when I heard gravity for the first time and then the rest of continuum. I have a couple tattoos that I connected with so much so I see them all the time and they are still in most meaningful to me
helped me the mos I was with a very Mentally emotionally abusive person for 17 years I thought that was how was going to be forever it took some time But I finally left and got divorced took more time to heal and love myself again and I know John Mayer does not know how he’s helped me so much to have the courage and the wanting to be happy again and he still does his music is beautiful and connects with so many people, and usually good people the bad people  not so much, like I had that were bad in my life do not like John much so they lost out I won and this song last train is probably the most beautiful intro acoustically that I’ve ever heard except one exception if you ever watched John Mayer on his own on YouTube it was a concert and the intro to hummingbird is on my loop and I’ve listen to it and slept to it a lot of times and I have it looped just for that intro because it’s that beautiful I use it to calm down when I have anxiety I listen to mostly acoustically when I’m feeling anxiety and when I’m feeling good I get to listen to the best guitar player in my life probably in a lot of generations and I get happy and I dance and I sing and I love his blues I love it hard and I love it soft, his music will always be part of my life  I know what I’m watching and he is the best I’ve ever seen and or heard and I feel so lucky that he stuck with it and as his fans we’ve all watched him come so far from the beginning I love as much as I love what he plays now. You know how he always says thank you after every song in every concert I’ve always wanted to tell him NO, thank you for helping me get through life ❤❤🎉

I think I can classify this song as 'one of the greatest' if not 'the greatest' love song I've ever heard.. I can't wait to dance with my fiance to this song after our wedding. It is so utterly everything.. it is all or nothing... and when two individuals feel this way about each other there are no words to describe the feelings.. but this song does the best job I can think of.. 'I surrender'.. it says everything... 
And then the guitar lead at the end emphasizes the surrender.. it's crazy good and I feel every note. Thank you John Mayer for this song!

text:
John, a beautiful soul. In my 20’s, I heard you play guitar from a clip off of one of your concerts. My dad, loved the blues. So I played the music. I said, he’s young, but he’s so awesome! My dad loved it!
Every Sunday he would ask me
If I John Mayers cd, and we would cook and dance, I drank wine, my hippy dad smoke his weed, and we just enjoyed the music, the day,
Life. Thank you John Mayer, for sharing your talent with the world and the beautiful memories I have because of it!! I am 45, my dad passed 3 years ago, but I still out John Mayer on on sundays! This song says it all! Beautiful expression

text: from the line John plays at 0:52 you can clearly tell that he has had the idea for 'last train' since at least 2008. Listen to the intro to 'where the light is' - it's exactly the same line he plays there and the whole song 'last train' is build around that line. So it took at least 13 years for this idea to develop and finally get produced as a song. And it certainly has gotten a masterpiece. Some ideas take a long time to ripen! https://youtu.be/SCDdjnHsiB8

text: I hear this album and I think, “am I being punked by JM?” As in, does he even like sob rock parenthesis yacht rock?  My instincts say, “No!”   He’s having fun with us! But then I wonder,” does he even care if we care?”  Ooo,  I don’t want that answer. Coincidentally I wonder what would have happened if Eddie would have embraced DLR’s throw back period to the kinks and such? Would we all be better off?; I think we would. So as a result I’ve been listening to wild blue, Christo cross and the doobie bros lately. Basically, people need to get over themselves already.  Also, a Paul David’s comment pinned … nice.
